title: Private Means and the Curious Incident of the Free Lunch
authors: Jack Fitzsimons, James Honaker, Michael Shoemate, Vikrant Singhal
abstract:
We show that the most well-known and fundamental building blocks of DP
implementations -- sum, mean, count (and many other linear queries) -- can be
released with substantially reduced noise for the same privacy guarantee. We
achieve this by projecting individual data with worst-case sensitivity $R$ onto
a simplex where all data now has a constant norm $R$. In this simplex,
additional ``free'' queries can be run that are already covered by the
privacy-loss of the original budgeted query, and which algebraically give
additional estimates of counts or sums, and can be combined for lower final
noise.
